reviews.review: Really enjoyed the approach of this puzzle game. Great atmosphere while playing and the humour written into the game is awesome! Many laughs while playing through this.

Can be a bit tricky to work out what to do next, but feels good when you solve the mystery. Also requires some dexterity to complete some levels, so not just a "brain game".

a brilliant sequel to portal it makes me hope that a 3rd game is made (ik not much hope 9 years later)

i honestly have difficulty finding anything negative to say about this game my only gripe is the slight stuttering when you enter loading screens and that some areas of the game are a bit dark which makes it hard to know how to proceed. not to mention that the single player campaign leaves you wanting more after only 6 hours.

positives-
better graphics than portal 1
wheatley is voiced by the amazing Stephen Merchant (the game deserves 5 stars alone just for this)
a greater backstory is developed for glados, aperture and chell (the character you are playing) and more puzzles which pose a genuine challenge are present in this game.

i got this game as part of the valve bundle and i have to say both portal games are defo worth it so if your picking up left 4 dead or half life make sure to give these a go

Продолжение первой части привносит в геймплей новые возможности и особенности, не уступая в инновациях другим играм. Интересное прохождение одиночной компании и уникальный кооперативный режим подарят множество эмоций и впечатлений, а главное с пользой для мозга.

So far I've only played portal 2 co-op with friends but have heard only great things about the single player campaign as well. The original levels are a great way to get acquainted with the game systems with everything really opening up in the bonus level area where you need to take everything you've learnt with your partner to solve more complex puzzles.
Looking forward to trying the single player and exploring the many secrets this game has to offer.

Cons: None.

Pros: There's a reason this game is so iconic. They took the groundbreaking core concepts from the first game and improved them even more to make possibly the best puzzle video game ever. But on top of the already incredible puzzles, they add a great story, with great voice acting, and great jokes. The co-op courses are essentially their own additional campaign. This is definitely worth the money.
